commander.name: Generale di Corpo d'Armata Petassi Manella
commander.notes: Commanded XXII Corps at Tobruk during Q4 1940

supply_logistics.supply_status: General reserve corps at Tobruk fortress. Best supply situation of all 10th Army corps due to direct port access at Tobruk. Fuel reserves excellent (15-18 days), ammunition stocks very good (20-25 days), water supply from Tobruk port/wells adequate. XXII Corps included fortress troops and heavy artillery for Tobruk defense. However, corps held in general reserve and not committed during Italian invasion of Egypt (Sept 1940) or initial Sidi Barrani deployment. When Operation Compass launched (9 Dec 1940), XXII Corps remained at Tobruk while forward corps destroyed.

weather_environment.terrain_type: Coastal plain at Tobruk - fortress/port location

subordinate_units.notes: At Tobruk during Q4 1940. Fortress garrison duties. NOT EXTRACTED - division file not available.
Sources conflict - some place Catanzaro under XXIII Corps, others under XXII Corps in Q4 1940. NOT EXTRACTED - division file not available.
Blackshirt division. Sources conflict on corps assignment Q4 1940. NOT EXTRACTED - division file not available.
Heavy coastal artillery, fortress engineers, garrison troops. NOT separate division but corps-level assets. NOT EXTRACTED.

tactical_doctrine.role: General reserve corps and Tobruk fortress defense. Best-supplied corps in 10th Army. NOT committed to forward operations at Sidi Barrani. Garrison and defensive role throughout Q4 1940.
special_capabilities: Tobruk port access - direct sea supply route
General reserve for 10th Army - could support any sector
Mixed infantry and militia divisions plus fortress troops
known_issues: NOT committed to action during Q4 1940 - remained in reserve
Blackshirt militia divisions lower quality than metropolitan divisions
After Operation Compass destroyed forward corps (Dec 1940), XXII Corps became trapped in Tobruk
Tobruk besieged by British Jan 1941 - 25,000 prisoners when fortress fell 21-22 Jan 1941
tactical_doctrine.desert_adaptations: Coastal fortress position at Tobruk. Water from port facilities and wells. Better logistical situation than inland desert positions.

scenario_suitability: What-if scenarios: XXII Corps committed to Sidi Barrani relief
special_rules: Fortress Defense: +2 to defense when in Tobruk fortifications
Port Supply: Best supply situation in 10th Army
General Reserve: Can be committed to any sector
Fortress Artillery: Heavy coastal guns available for shore bombardment/defense
Siege Vulnerability: After Operation Compass, trapped in Tobruk and besieged (Jan 1941)
historical_engagements: General reserve status - not committed to combat Q4 1940
Siege of Tobruk (21-22 January 1941) - fell to British, 25,000 prisoners
Did NOT participate in Sidi Barrani disaster (Dec 1940)

Wikipedia: XXII Army Corps (Italy) - Petassi Manella command (Tier 2, 65% confidence)

corps_composition.reason: Sources conflict on whether Catanzaro and 3 Gennaio divisions were under XXII Corps or XXIII Corps in Q4 1940. Only Sirte Division consistently placed with XXII Corps at Tobruk.
sources_checked: Wikipedia Operation Compass - varies by source
Multiple web searches show conflicting OOB data
corps_composition.mitigation: Need primary Italian sources (war diaries, official OOB documents) to resolve conflict. May need to show different configurations for different periods within Q4 1940 (organization may have changed Oct-Dec).

validation.confidence_explanation: Confidence CRITICALLY LOW at 48% (Tier 4 - research brief created). This XXII Corps file is a STRUCTURAL PLACEHOLDER demonstrating corps-level schema v3.0 compliance but contains NO actual TO&E data. All equipment/personnel totals are 0 because NONE of the subordinate divisions (61st Sirte, possibly 64th Catanzaro, possibly 4th CC.NN. '3 Gennaio') have been extracted. ADDITIONALLY, sources CONFLICT on exact corps composition - some place Catanzaro and 3 Gennaio under XXIII Corps instead of XXII Corps. Only consistent finding: 61st Sirte Division at Tobruk under XXII Corps command. Commander Petassi Manella confirmed from web sources but appointment date unknown. Historical role as general reserve/Tobruk garrison confirmed from Operation Compass sources. Supply/logistics data ESTIMATED for fortress corps with port access (best supply situation in 10th Army). Weather data standard for Tobruk coastal region Q4 1940. This file demonstrates the NEED to (1) extract subordinate divisions and (2) resolve source conflicts on corps composition before meaningful TO&E data can be produced. File included to show corps-level structure but flagged as Tier 4 (insufficient data) pending division extractions and OOB clarification.
